comments.author: jaderiveriver@yahoo.com
comments.creator: jaderiveriver@yahoo.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.6) Gecko/20070725 Firefox/2.0.0.6
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.6) Gecko/20070725 Firefox/2.0.0.6

My anti-spam software finds files beginning with "MyWay" and marks them as spam.  When I delete them my Firefox tool bar is also deleted.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run "SpyBot" anit-spyware software
2. Mark files to be cleaned/deleted
3. Apply actions
Actual Results:  
Firefox tool bar is gone






Expected Results:  
Sapm removed from my system without disruption to my Firefox browser.

Does Mozilla install its own spyware?
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.6) Gecko/20070725 Firefox/2.0.0.6
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.6) Gecko/20070725 Firefox/2.0.0.6

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run "SpyBot" anit-spyware software
2. Mark files to be cleaned/deleted
3. Apply actions
Actual Results:  
Firefox tool bar is gone






Expected Results:  
Sapm removed from my system without disruption to my Firefox browser.

Does Mozilla install its own spyware?

comments.author: jo.hermans@gmail.com
comments.text:
MyWay is indeed spyware (see <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MyWay_Searchbar>), but it's obviously not a part of FireFox.

I suggest you install a new profile : <http://kb.mozillazine.org/Creating_a_new_Firefox_profile_on_Windows>
comments.raw_text:

jaderiveriver@yahoo.com
comments.author: jaderiveriver@yahoo.com
comments.text: This does not help me at all.  This is information I already know.  I guess you guys have gone the way of Microsoft and are now as vulnerable.  I have uninstalled and reinstalled Firefox and it installs just as screwed up as it was when I uninstalled it.  My Bookmarks are all screwed up, do not show in the tool bar and will only launch when I click them from the "Organize Bookmarks" window.  This problem only started occurring when I installed the updated version of Firefox.  Is it time for me to look for a new more secure browser or can you actually help me out of this mess?

comments.author: jaderiveriver@yahoo.com
comments.creator: jaderiveriver@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
Never mind, I've decided its time for a new browser and have downloaded Opera - which is working just fine.

Good Luck

comments.author: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.creator: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.text: Sad to hear you moved to another browser, Jim. But it's your decision. Since we don't have enough information lets close this bug.
